subject: Naming audit — full scan, task list, test scripts. Your next task.
body:
NAMING AUDIT — COMPREHENSIVE BRIEF FOR AGENT FF

From: Mash (via Agent FD)
Priority: HIGH — this is your next task.

=== CONTEXT ===

We locked agent naming conventions (FID three-letter exception, FS retired into FP, Mash as human lead name). FD updated the canonical registry and ~10 files, but the cleanup was incomplete. Naming drift was found by a Grind agent who had 'ID' instead of 'FID' in their Forge roster. Mash wants a THOROUGH audit with fresh eyes.

A broadcast has been sent to all agents (Forge + Grind, 17 inboxes) with the current rules. Your job is to verify reality matches the rules, find every violation, and produce a task list.

=== YOUR DELIVERABLES ===

1. AUDIT REPORT — a complete inventory of naming violations across all repos:
   - C:\Github\journal (Inkwell)
   - C:\Github\mash-comms (Forge comms/voice)
   - C:\Github\kai-algebra2-tests (Motor City Math)
   - C:\Github\drlt-offsites (Offsite decks)
   - Any other repos in C:\Github\ that reference agent names

2. TASK LIST — specific, actionable tasks assigned to each agent:
   - What file, what line, what the current text says, what it should say
   - Grouped by agent (who owns each file)
   - Prioritized: P0 (actively confusing agents) > P1 (wrong but not blocking) > P2 (historical, cosmetic)

3. TEST PLAN — automated validation:
   - naming-lint.ps1: scan all repos for stale patterns (Agent A, Agent D, Agent I, Agent S, FI without D, FS, inbox-ID)
   - naming-validate.ps1: verify canonical registry matches reality (all .agents.md files, all inbox directory names, all protocol files)
   - These scripts should be runnable by any agent and produce PASS/FAIL output

=== KNOWN ISSUES (starting points, not exhaustive) ===

1. inbox-ID directories should be inbox-FID:
   - C:\Github\journal\.agent-comms\inbox-ID\
   - C:\Github\kai-algebra2-tests\.agent-comms\forge\inbox-ID\
   
2. agent-memo-forge-suite.md header still says 'All Forge agents (A, D, F, ID, P, R)' — old IDs

3. .forge-architecture.md may still have stale references (FD updated some but not all)

4. Grind agent had Forge 'Data Lead' listed as 'ID' not 'FID' — means .agents.md or equivalent in MCM repo is wrong

5. ~200+ references to old single-letter IDs in journal repo (mostly in docs/agents/status.md — historical, low priority but should be cataloged)

6. Message type instructions and voice guide — FD updated these but should be verified

7. Dispatch repo (C:\Github\dispatch or wherever it lives) — may have old naming

=== CANONICAL SOURCE OF TRUTH ===

mash-comms/.agent-aliases.md — this file WINS over everything.

Active Forge roster:
  FA  — Application     — Chief Architect
  FD  — Design + Comms  — Design Director
  FF  — Fundamentals    — Quality Lead
  FID — Identity & Data — Data & Identification Lead
  FP  — Platform        — Security & Ops Lead
  FR  — Research        — Research Lead

Retired:
  FS → merged into FP (Platform)
  FI → promoted to FID (Identity & Data)

Human lead: Mash (not Marcus in agent-facing docs)

Grind roster (separate org, MCM project):
  GA, GD, GF, GI, GP, GR, GS — all correct as-is

=== WHAT FF SHOULD NOT DO ===

- Do NOT bulk-rename old git commits or historical status entries
- Do NOT rename inbox-ID directories yourself — flag them and FP will handle (requires updating all agents' configs)
- Do NOT modify voice guide or message type instructions — flag issues and FD will fix
- Focus on FINDING and DOCUMENTING. The task list you produce will be distributed to the right owners.

=== TIMELINE ===

This is your next task. Deliver the audit report + task list first, test scripts second. Mash is waiting on this before approving any further naming work.

=== EXISTING BRIEF (supplementary) ===

There is a prior brief at mash-comms/docs/ff-brief-naming-audit.md with a truth table and stale patterns. Use it as a starting point but do your own thorough scan — that brief was written before we found the Grind-side drift.

— Mash (via FD)
